This is not currently supported. You can write your own script to support it.
You can manually restart the workflow instance using ```restart from failed node``` after force successed the task instance.

> You can manually restart the workflow instance using `restart from failed node` after force successed the task instance.

I want to skip this node, and execute the next node.if i restart the workflow, the node is always fail.
For example, if i depend 3 table, but one table is fail today(may be have data skew or have not enough resource to execute), so i have to skip the depend, i think this is a common quastion in daliy scheduler. Is this as expected in current version?

![](https://vip2.loli.io/2022/05/16/HfK8nskXqoijLJA.png)

There is a function named ```Recovery Failed``` in workflow instance page which could skip the force suceess  task node and restart from the next task node.

> 

I have tried to upgrade 1.3.5 to 1.3.9 ,and then 2.0.5. successful from 1.3.5 to 1.3.9, but the same error from 1.3.9 to 2.0.5.

@zhongjiajie help

### Search before asking

- [X] I had searched in the [issues](https://github.com/apache/dolphinscheduler/issues?q=is%3Aissue) and found no similar issues.


### What happened

When ds-2.0.5 downloaded the source package and tried to compile and package locally, the following error occurred:


### What you expected to happen

[ERROR] Failed to execute goal org.codehaus.mojo:exec-maven-plugin:3.0.0:exec (python-api-prepare) on project dolphinscheduler-python: Command execution failed. Process exited with an error: 1 (Exit value: 1) -> [Help 1]
Specifically as shown in the figure below:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13825054/168565851-d7563b98-c05c-4749-86e1-3cb236677070.png)


### How to reproduce

Checked the similar issues on the issue, such as: [8820](https://github.com/apache/dolphinscheduler/issues/8820), I confirmed that my current python3 environment is normal, what should I do?
Current environment:
jdk1.8
ds2.0.5 (tag version downloaded on git)
python3.7.8
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13825054/168565137-3985228b-3e51-4aa5-8fc8-1b103ec47276.png)


### Anything else

_No response_

### Version

2.0.5

- [X] Yes I am willing to submit a PR!
